Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture showing a plant that has enough water and light, highlighting how it looks healthy and green.
The student can draw a picture of a plant without water, showing signs like wilted leaves or dry soil to indicate its need for water.
The student can draw a picture of a plant kept in the dark, showing how it may look pale or fail to grow well.
The student can illustrate the difference in appearance between a healthy plant with water and light and another plant without one or both.
The student can identify and explain through drawings that plants need water and light to live and grow.
